intro: Psephellus yusufeliensis, commonly known as the Yusufeli rockrose, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage consists of small, linear leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
